action.action-desc: Mr. Polis introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to establish requirements relating to marijuana impaired driving, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Lucid Act
.

section.header: Safety incentives to prevent operation of motor vehicles by intoxicated persons

subsection.text: Section 163 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

In addition to the other requirements of this section, in the case of a State in which the use of marijuana is legal under the laws of the State with or without medical justification, the State shall be eligible for a grant under subsection (b), and shall be exempt from withholding under subsection (e), for a fiscal year only if the State—

paragraph.text: has in effect a law that prohibits an individual from driving or being in actual physical control of a motor vehicle while impaired by marijuana as determined using measures established by the State; and
enforces that law using training and methods for determining cognitive or physical marijuana impairment.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to fiscal years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act.

section.header: Minimum penalties for repeat offenders for driving while intoxicated or driving under the influence

subsection.text: Section 164(a)(2) of title 23, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Driving while intoxicated; driving under the influence
paragraph.text: The terms driving while intoxicated and driving under the influence mean—

subparagraph.text: driving or being in actual physical control of a motor vehicle while having an alcohol concentration above the permitted limit as established by each State; and

in the case of a State in which the use of marijuana is legal under the laws of the State with or without medical justification, driving or being in actual physical control of a motor vehicle while impaired by marijuana as determined using measures established by the State.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to fiscal years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act.
